text:
*Club for the Future invites you to thank a teacher with our Postcards to Space program*


                     Educators motivate and inspire students every day, and we believe they deserve out-of-this-world appreciation.
In honor of Teacher Appreciation Week, Club for the Future invites students and parents to design a “thank you” postcard from space to teachers, administrators, and school staff.
Mail the postcards to us, and we will send them to space on a future New Shepard rocket launch. After the postcards land safely back on Earth, we’ll mail them to your teachers stamped "Flown to Space" as a special keepsake.
*INSTRUCTIONS* 
*STEP ONE* 
 Download and print postcards from our template. <https://blueorigin.us9.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ca4c14684ac1af3f1219b4382&id=4c7eb33893&e=7134aa39ed|Find the PDF here>. Don’t have a printer? Craft your own postcard from the back of notepads, cereal boxes, or notecards.

 *STEP TWO* 
 Write or draw your “thank you” note on the postcard.

 *STEP THREE*
 Post a picture of your postcard on social media with the hashtag #postcardstospace. Be sure to tell us what makes your teacher out of this world and tag us on <https://blueorigin.us9.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ca4c14684ac1af3f1219b4382&id=20dc639490&e=7134aa39ed|Twitter> (@ClubforFuture), <https://blueorigin.us9.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ca4c14684ac1af3f1219b4382&id=5a1dc71b37&e=7134aa39ed|Facebook> (@ClubfortheFuture), and <https://blueorigin.us9.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ca4c14684ac1af3f1219b4382&id=2deae2dfc5&e=7134aa39ed|Instagram> (@ClubforFuture).

 *STEP FOUR*
 Place a postage stamp on each postcard and address them with your teacher’s name and the school where they work.
 Ms. or Mr. Awesome
 123 Happy Middle School
 City, State Zip

 *STEP FIVE* 
 Put all of your postcards in one envelope or box and send to:
 Club for the Future
 PO Box 5759
 Kent, WA 98064
 U.S.A.

 *STEP SIX*
 We’ll launch your postcard on a future New Shepard flight. Follow <http://Blueorigin.com|Blueorigin.com> and subscribe to <https://blueorigin.us9.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ca4c14684ac1af3f1219b4382&id=d4836d873f&e=7134aa39ed|Blue Origin on YouTube> to learn how to watch upcoming launches.

 *STEP SEVEN - FINALLY!* 
 Upon an Earthly landing, your “thank you” postcards will be stamped “Flown to Space” and mailed through the United States Post Office to your teachers.

 Just a reminder - here are the Postcard <https://blueorigin.us9.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ca4c14684ac1af3f1219b4382&id=8f980adcf2&e=7134aa39ed|PDF> template and <https://blueorigin.us9.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ca4c14684ac1af3f1219b4382&id=76250551e9&e=7134aa39ed|printable instructions>.

 From all of us at Club for the Future, we say THANK YOU to the entire education community for their hard work and dedication. Earth needs inspired students.

attachments.text: Blue Origin was founded in 2000 by Jeff Bezos with the vision to enable a future where millions of people are living and working in space to benefit Earth. Blue believes we must protect Earth by moving heavy industries that stress our planet into space, and enable humanity to access space to expand, explore, and find new energy and material resources. Then we can see a dynamic and abundant future for our grandchildren’s grandchildren. There is no plan B for Earth. To enable this future, we must build a road to space to lower the cost of getting there. Blue is working on this today by developing operationally reusable launch vehicles that are safe, reliable and highly available. Every launch vehicle is designed for human spaceflight from the beginning and able to ferry payloads to space. Join the mission to build a road to space - step by step ferociously. #GradatimFerociter
attachments.title: Blue Origin
